description.para: A c:result element containing the absolute URI of the target (the c prefix here is bound to the http://www.w3.org/ns/xproc-step namespace).
The URI of the source file or directory to copy from.
The URI of the target file or directory to copy to.
Determines what happens if an error occurs during the copy operation:

listitem.para: If this option is true (default), an appropriate XProc error is raised.
If this option is false, the step returns a c:error document (see here for more information) on its result port.

description.para: If you’re copying a directory, please note that an error may mean that a partial copy has already been made.
Determines what happens if needs to overwrite an existing file:

listitem.para: If this option is true (default), the existing file is overwritten.
If this option is false, no existing file will be changed.

summary.para: The step copies a file or a directory to a given target.

description.para: The step copies a file or a directory, as specified in the href option, to the target given in the target option. Any non-existent directory in the target option value will be created.

If the target option specifies a directory (ends with a slash /), the step attempts to copy the source file or directory into the target directory, preserving its name. This means that you cannot use to copy a directory to another location under a different name. See the example on how you do can achieve this.

detail.para: Relative values for the href and target options are resolved against the base URI of the element on which this option is specified. In most cases this will be the static base URI of your pipeline (the path where the XProc source containing the is stored).
